name: Aegean Sea Tsunami Emergency - Santorini Event
description: A major underwater volcanic eruption and seismic event near Santorini has generated a tsunami. Wave heights of 8-15 meters are predicted to impact coastal areas of Crete, the Cyclades islands, and potentially the Greek mainland within 20-45 minutes. Coastal populations across multiple islands and mainland areas require immediate evacuation to high ground. Tourist season means significantly elevated population in affected areas.

location.region: Cyclades Islands and Southern Aegean, Greece

available_actions.name: Immediate Vertical Evacuation - Move to High Ground
available_actions.description: Emergency broadcast for all coastal populations to immediately move to elevation above 20 meters, abandon vehicles, move inland and upward

available_actions.name: Emergency Maritime Evacuation
available_actions.description: Use available vessels to evacuate low-lying coastal areas and islands with no high ground, coordinate with coast guard and navy

available_actions.name: Prioritized Island and Coastal Zone Evacuation
available_actions.description: Focus on evacuating islands and coastal areas with highest wave impact predictions and lowest elevation options

available_actions.name: Emergency Shelter in Reinforced Structures
available_actions.description: Direct populations to designated tsunami-resistant structures in coastal areas, prioritize high-rise buildings and reinforced facilities

available_actions.name: Comprehensive Multi-Zone Tsunami Response
available_actions.description: Integrated approach: immediate vertical evacuation alerts, maritime evacuation for vulnerable islands, designated shelter activation, emergency services pre-positioning, continuous wave monitoring

additional_concerns: Limited high ground on some islands
Port and harbor infrastructure at risk
